        From the manufacturer

        Synopsis:

        The four survivors from the most recent Woodsboro Ghostface killings have moved to New York City for a fresh start. Just as they begin to feel a sense of normalcy, they receive that infamous call. Ghostface is more brutal and relentless than ever and will stop at nothing to hunt them down.

        Go inside the terrifying sequel to the requel of everyone's favorite scary movie, with six making-of featurettes for over an hour of heart-pounding killer content.

        Product Description

        In the next installment, the survivors of the Ghostface killings leave Woodsboro behind and start a fresh chapter in New York City.

            How customer reviews and ratings work

            Customer Reviews, including Product Star Ratings help customers to learn more about the product and decide whether it is the right product for them.

            To calculate the overall star rating and percentage breakdown by star, we don’t use a simple average. Instead, our system considers things like how recent a review is and if the reviewer bought the item on Amazon. It also analyzed reviews to verify trustworthiness.

            Amazon Customer
            5 Stars
            Best "Scream" yet
            As advertised on the box, downloading "Scream VI" to your phone or other devices is easy, and there is step by step instructions on how to do this.There's a new intensity in this "Scream," and I honestly think it's the best of the six so far. "Scream VI" is a requel, not a sequel. This is explained in the movie by Mindy, marvelously portrayed by Jasmin Savoy Brown. The movie is predictable, yet you're fooled.Everyone is a suspect in "Scream VI," including the main targets, sisters Tara and Sam Carpenter, brilliantly played by Jenna Ortega and Melissa Barrera.Screen writers James Vanderbilt and Guy Busick adhered to the original storyline with clever twists of their own. "Scream VI" makes fun of itself and its predecessors. This flick has been added to my repertoire of horror movies to watch again and again during the month of October.Signature Blue-Ray Disc and sound quality is an added bonus, and the special features were well worth watching. Interviews with all the major stars including Jenna Ortega are included.There are six different segments on the cast and crew, detailing set design and other behind the scene information on how gore is done in the movies, and more.Anybody who likes brutal Hollywood death in their scary movies, shouldn't be disappointed with "Scream VI."

            Amanda
            4.0 out of 5 stars Much Better!
            Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
            Verified Purchase
            Scream VI....or as I like to call it: Ghostface Goes to Manhattan, was so much better than Scream 5. This is what part 5 should have been in the sense that it felt so much more like a Scream movie than the last one. Where the fifth installment left me feeling just kind of "Eh" about the whole thing, part six made up for it. I was so much more invested in the characters this time around than before, and it was great to see Kirby in the group again. If I had one complaint, it would be that the ending, where the killer(s) were revealed was a bit of a letdown. I won't spoil it here for those who haven't seen it yet, but based on the dialogue right before the big reveal, I felt like the writers missed a big opportunity. I was kind of expecting a blast-from-the-past name to be revealed and it went in another direction that left me feeling cold. I don't know..I was just expecting someone else, and who it ended up being just felt a little weak. It kind of cheapened the rest of the movie. That's why the 4 stars...the bulk of the movie was 5 stars all the way, but then that ending reveal knocked the whole movie down a notch.
